snippet: The suit accuses the industry of having targeted Gwynn while in college as part of a scheme to market its products to rising-star athletes and African-Americans.
abstract: Family of baseball Hall of Famer Tony Gwynn files wrongful-death lawsuit, blaming Altria Group, formerly known as Philip Morris, and several other defendants for Gwynn's addiction to smokeless tobacco; claims defendants were part of concerted effort to market tobacco products to African-Americans and saw Gwynn as perfect advertising vehicle.
lead_paragraph: The suit accuses the industry of having targeted Gwynn while in college as part of a scheme to market its products to rising-star athletes and African-Americans.

headline.main: Tony Gwynn’s Family Sues Tobacco Industry, Seeking Recourse Over Fatal Habit
headline.print_headline: Seeking Recourse for Three Decades of Addiction
